intro: Spermacoce perennis var. perennis, commonly known as the perennial spurred gentian, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its upright, branched stems and opposite, ovate leaves with hairy surfaces. The plant produces small, blue or purple flowers that are clustered in cymes, often with a spurred shape on the petals. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a notable species in ecological and horticultural contexts.
